list_definition.definition: to have confidence or faith; to believe
to give (something to someone), believing that it will be used well and responsibly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I can’t trust him with my car
I can’t trust my car to him.
I trust (that) you had / will have a good journey.

list_definition.definition: belief or confidence in the power, reality, truth, goodness etc of a person or thing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The firm has a great deal of trust in your ability
The child was placed in my trust.

list_definition.definition: a task etc given to a person by someone who believes that they will do it, look after it etc well

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He holds a position of trust in the firm.

list_definition.definition: arrangement(s) by which something (eg money) is given to a person to use in a particular way, or to keep until a particular time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The money was to be held in trust for his children

list_definition.mean_english: nhóm công ty cùng làm ăn
list_definition.definition: a group of business firms working together

list_ex_of_english: The renewed fighting has shattered years of negotiations, but more importantly, robbed its citizens of trusting the other side and of the peace process.
When ranked according to performance on key variables 118 trusts scored three or less.
Educational meetings were held by all trusts, although they varied in nature and extent and the planning of training was at an early stage.
There are three kinds of values around during reduction: trusted, distrusted and untagged.
Right-wing cabinets, trusting the capacity of private agents to supply the levels of savings and investment optimal to sustain growth, pushed through sizeable privatization packages.
In total, 13 (35%) of the later trusts said that their health authorities had set the agenda, compared with five (19%) of the early trusts.
A qualitative study of the introduction of nurse practitioners trusted the judgement of nurse practitioners and signed prescriptions without assessing a patient (unless requested to).
In addition, it is possible to interactively declare further functions to be trusted during debugging.
